result.execSummary:
The defendant Ya Chang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: all other sentences currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed;
Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two;

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: all other sentences currently serving

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ya Chang

records.addlTxt:
10:41 a.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 21CM1109, 21CM1110, and 22CF175.

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears from Dodge Correctional Institution via Zoom video; Attorney Russ Kort appears via Zoom video.

Date and time set for a Sentencing Hearing. VRCW. 

COURT addresses defendant and his appearance via Zoom video.
Defendant makes statement regarding quarantine policy. 
All parties have received the PSI report.
Atty Kort notes no inaccuracies.
ADA Boeck notes no corrections.
ADA Boeck makes sentencing arguments. 
Atty Kort makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT makes findings.
COURT ORDERS: on 22CF175, Ct 1: 6 years WPS (3 yrs IC; 3 yrs ES), to run concurrent to all other sentences currently serving; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; DNA sample and surcharge; Eligible for programming; and CC.  93 days jail credit. 

ADJ: 11:06 a.m.
Request to Appear via Zoom - APPROVED 7-20-22
Waiver of Right for Personal Appearance
Cash Bond signed- not posted (Transported to prison)

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 3:03 pm. 
INCLUDES: 21CM1109, 21CM1110 & 22CF175.

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck.
Defendant Ya Chang appears in person, in custody and with Attorney Russ Kort.

Date/Time set for plea hearing.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. 

State moves to: 
21CM1109:
Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia - Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia - Repeater) >> DRI.

21CM1110:
Ct. 1 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia - Repeater) >> DRI. 

22CF75:
Ct. 2 (Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.
Ct. 3 (Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor / Repeater) >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA:
22CF175:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g)-Repeater/PTAC) >> NO CONTEST.

Court finds plea has been made freely, knowingly and voluntarily. Defendant is found guilty. 

FUTURE DATES:
Argued Sentencing w/ PSI: 07/22/2022 @ 9:00 am. 
PSI Due: 07/01/2022.

Adjourned: 3:14 pm.

Plea hearing on April 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Includes 21CM1109, 21CM1110, 22CF175
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant does not appear; Attorney Russ Kort appears in person.
DATES SET:
Plea 4/22/22 at 3:00 pm
PSI due 7/01/2022
Argued Sentencing: 7/22/22 at 9:00 am (1 Hour)

cc: Branch 6 case.

Review hearing on February 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on February 21, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Plea hearing on March 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

INCLUDES 22CF175, 21CM1109, 21CM1110: $2,500.00 signature bond with the first $750.00 in cash.  No contact with co-defendant Tou Yang (22CF175).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. No possession of drug paraphernalia.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
